Table of Contents

Class RelativeFileService<T>

Namespace
MdFilesMerger.App.Common
Assembly
MdFilesMerger.App.dll

Implementation of additional methods for handling collection of objects associated with .md files, whose paths are stored as relative to connected main directory path.

Inheritance: BaseService<T> -> BaseDirectoryService<T> -> RelativeFileService<T>
Implements: ICRUDService<T>, IDirectoryService<T>, IRelativeFileService<T>, IService<T> 

public class RelativeFileService<T> : BaseDirectoryService<T>, IRelativeFileService<T>, IDirectoryService<T>, ICRUDService<T>, IService<T> where T : class, IRelativeFile

Type Parameters

T

RelativeFile or type derived from it.

Methods

FindNewFiles(IEnumerable<FileInfo>, IMainDirectory)

In the list of files connected with specified main directory, finds files, that aren't associated with any element in the stored collection.

public List<FileInfo> FindNewFiles(IEnumerable<FileInfo> list, IMainDirectory mainDirectory)

Parameters

list IEnumerable<FileInfo>

The list of files.

mainDirectory IMainDirectory

The main directory for files on the list.

Returns

List<FileInfo>

List of files not associated with any element in the stored collection.

ReadByMainDirId(int)

Gets, from the stored collection, elements with the specified main directory identifier.

public List<T> ReadByMainDirId(int mainDirId)

Parameters

mainDirId int

The searched main directory identifier.

Returns

List<T>

The list of objects with the specified main directory identifier. If there is no objects with MainDirId equal mainDirId, returned list is empty.

UpdatePath(int, string)

Updates the relative path of .md file associated with the element with specified identification number.

public override int UpdatePath(int id, string path)

Parameters

id int

The identification number of updated element.

path string

Absolute or relative (to current directory) path to existing .md file, that you want to associate with the element being updated.

Returns

int

Identification number of updated element or -1, if update failed.
